hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Rebound Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a cascade long liquidation event (>$300M in 24h) that drives BTC price below its 20-day SMA, a rapid 2-hour rebound of >1.5% that occurs on declining volume (<80% of drop volume) will fail, and price will retrace 50-70% of that rebound within the next 8 hours, providing a short entry opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidation-driven drops often see weak, low-volume rebounds as trapped longs exit. The low volume indicates lack of fresh buying. The 20-day SMA acts as resistance in bearish/neutral regimes. Fading weak rebounds after liquidations captures the secondary leg down.
entry_conditions: Rally volume <80% of preceding 2-hour drop volume
Entry: Sell limit at 0.25% below rally high after first 15-minute bearish reversal candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement of the 2-hour rally (from entry price)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >55% of rebounds continue upward past stop-loss; average win/loss ratio <1.3; or signal frequency <2 per month in historical stress periods.
